definitions.definition: going in a straight line towards somewhere or someone without stopping or changing direction:
without anyone or anything else being involved or between:
examples: She decided to take direct control of the project.

definitions.definition: strong light or heat that has nothing protecting and separating you from it:
examples: This plant should be kept out of direct sunlight.

definitions.definition: a relation who is related to you through one of your parents, not through an aunt or uncle, etc.:
examples: Diana is a direct descendant of Robert Peel.

definitions.definition: in a straight line towards somewhere without stopping or changing direction:
examples: Does this bus go direct to the airport?

definitions.definition: without anyone or anything else being involved or between:
examples: I intended to go direct to the manager with my complaint.

definitions.definition: to control or be in charge of an activity, organization, etc.:
to tell people the direction in which they must drive:
examples: There was a police officer directing the traffic.

definitions.definition: to be in charge of a film or play and tell the actors how to play their parts:
examples: He wanted to give up acting and start directing (his own films).

definitions.definition: without having to stop or change direction:
examples: Does this train go direct to Edinburgh?

definitions.definition: without anything or anyone else being involved or in between:
examples: Can I dial this number direct or do I have to go through the switchboard?
